other_tests.procedure_name: Ultrasound of the Liver or Gallbladder
other_tests.findings: Multiple gallstones are seen layering within the gallbladder. Pericholecystic fluid is present. The gallbladder is not significantly distended and there is no thickening of the gallbladder wall; however, mild hyperemia of the gallbladder wall is present. The hepatic parenchyma appears within normal limits. The liver contour is smooth, and there is no focal liver mass. The main portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow. No intrahepatic biliary dilation is noted.
